tn.ref: Connecting Statement:
tn.text: Having explained his changed plans and his ministry direction, Paul talks about giving.

tn.ref: the grace of God that has been given to the churches of Macedonia
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the grace that God has given to the churches of Macedonia" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the abundance of their joy and the extremity of their poverty have produced great riches of generosity
tn.text: Paul speaks of "joy" and "poverty" as if they were living things that can produce generosity. AT: "because of the people's great joy and extreme poverty, they have become very generous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: the abundance of their joy
tn.text: Paul speaks of joy as if it were a physical object that could increase in size or quantity. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: extremity of their poverty ... riches of generosity
tn.text: Though the churches of Macedonia have suffered testings of affliction and poverty, by God's grace, they have been able to collect money for the believers in Jerusalem.

tn.ref: great riches of generosity
tn.text: "a very great generosity." The words "great riches" emphasize the greatness of their generosity.

tn.ref: they gave
tn.text: This refers to the churches in Macedonia.

tn.ref: of their own free will
tn.text: "voluntarily"

tn.ref: with much begging they pleaded with us
tn.text: Here the words "begging" and "pleaded" share similar meanings and emphasize the earnestness with which the people pleaded. AT: "they pleaded very earnestly with us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: this ministry to the believers
tn.text: Paul is referring to providing money to the believers in Jerusalem. AT: "this ministry of providing for the believers in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: who had already begun this task
tn.text: Paul is referring to the collection of money from the Corinthians for the believers in Jerusalem. AT: "who had encouraged your giving in the first place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: to bring to completion this act of generosity on your part
tn.text: Titus was to help the Corinthians to complete the collection of money. AT: "to encourage you to complete your generous gift" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: But you abound in everything
tn.text: Paul speaks of the Corinthian believers as if they were producing physical goods. AT: "You do well in so many ways" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: make sure that you abound in this generous deed
tn.text: Paul speaks of the Corinthian believers as if they should produce physical goods. AT: "make sure you do well in giving for the believers in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: by comparing it to the eagerness of other people
tn.text: Paul is encouraging the Corinthians to give generously by comparing them with the generosity of the Macedonian churches. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the grace of our Lord
tn.text: In this context, the word "grace" emphasizes the generosity with which Jesus had blessed the Corinthians.

tn.ref: Even though he was rich, for your sakes he became poor
tn.text: Paul speaks of Jesus before his incarnation as being rich, and of his becoming human as becoming poor. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: through his poverty you might become rich
tn.text: Paul speaks of the Corinthians becoming spiritually rich as a result of Jesus becoming human. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: In this matter
tn.text: This refers to their collecting money to give to the believers in Jerusalem. AT: "With regard to the collection" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: there was an eagerness and desire to do it
tn.text: This can be stated with a verbal phrase. AT: "you were eager and desired to do it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: bring it to completion
tn.text: "complete it" or "finish it"

tn.ref: a good and acceptable thing
tn.text: Here the words "good" and "acceptable" share similar meanings and emphasize the goodness of the thing. AT: "a very good thing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: It must be based on what a person has
tn.text: "Giving must be based on what a person has"

tn.ref: For this task
tn.text: This refers to collecting money for the believers in Jerusalem. AT: "For this task of collecting money" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: that others may be relieved and you may be burdened
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that you may relieve others and burden yourselves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: there should be fairness
tn.text: "there should be equality"

tn.ref: This is also so that their abundance may supply your need
tn.text: Since the Corinthians are acting in the present time, it is implied that the believers in Jerusalem will also help them at some time in the future. AT: "This is also so that in the future their abundance may supply your need"

tn.ref: as it is written
tn.text: Here Paul quotes from Exodus. This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Moses wrote" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: did not have any lack
tn.text: This can be stated positively. AT: "had all he needed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])

tn.ref: who put into Titus' heart the same earnest care that I have for you
tn.text: Here the word "heart" refers to the emotions. This means that God caused Titus to love them. AT: "who made Titus care for you as much as I do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: same earnest care
tn.text: "the same enthusiasm" or "same deep concern"

tn.ref: For he not only accepted our appeal
tn.text: Paul is referring to his asking Titus to return to Corinth and complete the collection. AT: "For he not only agreed to our request that he help you with the collection" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: with him
tn.text: "with Titus"

tn.ref: the brother who is praised among all of the churches
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the brother whom believers among all of the churches praise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Not only this
tn.text: "Not only do believers among all of the churches praise him"

tn.ref: he also was selected by the churches
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the churches also selected him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: in our carrying out this act of generosity
tn.text: "to carry out this act of generosity." This refers to taking the offering to Jerusalem.

tn.ref: for our eagerness to help
tn.text: "to demonstrate our eagerness to help"

tn.ref: concerning this generosity that we are carrying out
tn.text: "concerning the way we are handling this generous gift." This refers to taking the offering to Jerusalem.

tn.ref: We take care to do what is honorable
tn.text: "We are careful to handle this gift in an honorable way"

tn.ref: before the Lord ... before people
tn.text: "in the Lord's opinion ... in people's opinion"

tn.ref: with them
tn.text: The word "them" refers to Titus and the previously mentioned brother.

tn.ref: he is my partner and fellow worker for you
tn.text: "he is my partner who works with me to help you"

tn.ref: As for our brothers
tn.text: This refers to the two other men who will accompany Titus.

tn.ref: they are sent by the churches
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the churches have sent them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: They are an honor to Christ
tn.text: This can be stated with a verbal phrase. AT: "They will cause people to honor Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
